intro: Courbonia subcordata, commonly known as the small-leaved courbonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, smooth, yellowish drupe that ripens in the dry season.
